title: fix pylint build file
body:
Thanks @caofangkun found this problem. This PR fixes #1001 

Bazel requires BUILD files in third_party have licenses at the head. `third_party/python/pylint/BUILD` is the only one missing this license information.

[Here](https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel/issues/642)'s the discussion in bazel github page.

[Here](http://www.bazel.io/docs/be/functions.html#licenses)'s more about the licenses function in bazel doc.

title: Remove ArrayList boxing
body:
`Arrays.asList()` returns a private inner class implementation of ArrayList [see here](http://grepcode.com/file/repository.grepcode.com/java/root/jdk/openjdk/6-b14/java/util/Arrays.java#3355). This class is not register with kryo by default and it is a tedious to
do so. The fallout of this is that anyone who uses the RawScheme will receive the following exception:

`java.lang.RuntimeException: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Class
is not registered: java.util.Arrays$ArrayList`

title: fix SpoutInstance OutQueueFullCount metric
body:
The `isProduceTuple()` returns false in either of the following two cases:
1. the OutQueue is not available
2. the topology is not in RUNNING state

`OutQueueFullCount` metric should only be increased when the out queue is not available and unchanged when the topology is not in RUNNING state

title: heron-explorer
body:
`heron-explorer` is a command-line tool, which has functionalities equivalent to `heron-ui`'s.
#### Background

Heron UI is designed for users to allow them have a good understanding the status of their topologies. It provides a wide range of information in an organized way. However, we believe there is also need for a command-line tool that displays topology information on terminal. The CLI tool `heron-explorer` has the following advantages over `heron-ui`:
- One can get desired information instantly on terminal, instead of opening web browser, clicking several buttons, and searching on the webpage
- Auto-complete feature via [Bash Programmable Completion](https://www.gnu.org/software/bash/manual/html_node/Programmable-Completion.html) (which is possibly going to be implemented in the next cycle)
#### Design

The design is quite simple. 

`heron-explorer` parses user input using Pythons `argparse` library. It reuses API call wrapper in `heron.ui.src.python.handlers.access` to talk to heron-tracker. It then converts API call result from JSON structure to tabulate and prints it on the terminal.

`heron-explorer` assumes `heron-tracker` locates at `127.0.0.1:8888`, but tracker base URL can be optionally set using `--tracker_url`. 

As with `heron`, `heron-explorer` will attempt to find the config for the cluster that user specifies. If the desired config file exists, command line arguments role and environment can be omitted.

**Note**: `heron-tracker` is extended so that its API supports `role` parameter. This means that we can make API call that queries topologies submitted only by specified user. It is extended in a way such that no function using its current APIs will break. See #979 for more details. 
#### Functionalites

`heron-explorer` currently supports three main categories of subcommands.
##### Display existing clusters
- `heron-explorer clusters`  
  The `clusters` subcommand displays existing clusters.
##### Display running topologies
- `heron-explorer topologies cluster/[role]/[env]`  
  The `show` subcommand displays running topologies. Cluster name is required, while role and environment name are optional. 
##### Display logical plan info of a particular topology
- `heron-explorer bolts cluster/[role]/[env] topology`  
  The `bolts` subcommand displays bolts of a running topology. 
- `heron-explorer spouts cluster/[role]/[env] topology`  
  The `spouts` subcommand displays spouts of a running topology. 
- `heron-explorer components cluster/[role]/[env] topology`  
  The `components` subcommand displays spouts and bolts of a running topology. 
##### Display physical plan info of a particular topology
- `heron-explorer metrics cluster/[role]/[env] topology [--component COMP]`  
  The `metrics` subcommand displays metrics of components in all the physical containers of a topology. Component name can be optionally provided so that only metrics of selected component will be displayed.

Display physical plan info of a particular topology
- `heron-explorer containers cluster/[role]/[env] topology [--cid ID]`  
  The `containers` subcommand shows all the physical containers of a running topology. --cid can be optionally provided so that only information of selected container will be displayed.

Other commands
- `heron-explorer help [subcommand]`  
  The `help` subcommand displays usage of a subcommand.
- `heron-explorer version`  
  The `version` subcommand shows heron-explorers version.

Thanks for all the Heron team members who provided comments and suggestions.

title: #974 update slf4j version from 1.7.7 to latest 1.7.21
body:
slf4j creates warning messages on stderr like following:

```
SLF4J: The following set of substitute loggers may have been accessed
SLF4J: during the initialization phase. Logging calls during this
SLF4J: phase were not honored. However, subsequent logging calls to these
SLF4J: loggers will work as normally expected.
SLF4J: See also http://www.slf4j.org/codes.html#substituteLogger
SLF4J: org.eclipse.aether.internal.impl.DefaultRepositorySystem
SLF4J: org.eclipse.aether.internal.impl.DefaultMetadataResolver
SLF4J: org.apache.maven.repository.internal.DefaultVersionResolver
```

update SLF4J version from 1.7.7 to latest 1.7.21 is likely to solve this issue.

title: Apply override config on scheduler
body:
Currently any override config passed to heron-cli would apply on client side, i.e. SubmitterMain or RuntimeManagerMain only.
This pull request would apply the override config on server side, for instance, SchedulerMain, too.

title: dockerfile for release image
body:
@kramasamy @tysonnorris #526 Dockerfile for docker release image (0.14.0).  Any improvements are welcome.  Note `RUN mkdir -p ~/.herondata/repository/state/local/topologies` command is needed to successfully launch heron-tracker, heron-ui prior to submitting topology.

Build:
`docker build -t name:0.14.0-ubuntu -f Dockerfile.ubuntu14.04-heron0.14.0 .` 
Run:
`docker run -it -p 8888:8888 -p 8889:8889 name:0.14.0-ubuntu /bin/bash`

tracker and ui will be on local machine with `docker-machine-ip:8888` and `8889` respectively.

title: Limit the maximum size of heron tuple set
body:
Currently heron can only limit # of tuples inside heron tuple set, but can not limit the size in bytes.
Sometimes misconfig can lead to constructing protobuf bigger than default limitation to parse (64M).

This pull request limits the maximum size of heron tuple set. It is a soft bound, calculating the size of
tuple set. And once the size exceeds the limitation, we will create a new heron tuple set.

title: wget as linkchecker
body:
This PR comes with the following changes:
1. Fix Java documentation character escaping errors introduced in https://github.com/twitter/heron/commit/9f8b0b04b2c9bd767b74c57451759aebbd28400e
2. Copy `public/api` to `static/api` so that the following link checking mechanism can work well. 
   See related discussion at #798.
3. Use `wget` as link checker instead of 3rd party's `linkchecker`. 
   This change has two benefits.
   1. Less dependencies. No Python's `request` library is needed. 
      We can reuse `wget` which is [easily installed by Travis CI](https://github.com/twitter/heron/blob/master/.travis.yml#L16).
   2. Working better with static site generator `hugo`. The current `linkchecker` does not fully understand the website generated by static site generator. It considers Java documentation pages as external links and even `--check-extern` flag is set, it fails to find the actual location of those documentation pages. This PR runs `hugo` in the background to serve the website and then runs `wget` to recursively check all links. This is almost the same as using `wget` directly on `http://twitter.github.io/heron/`.

This PR addresses issues #766, #770, #797, #798.

/cc @billonahill @lucperkins

title: YARN scheduler for Heron
body:
YARN scheduler for Heron is implemented using Apache REEF framework. Each Heron topology will be executed as a YARN application, which includes per topology application master and containers. YARN scheduler supports topology submission, kill, and restart. It also provides container HA (currently AM HA is not supported)
Previous related pull requests: https://github.com/twitter/heron/pull/419 and https://github.com/twitter/heron/pull/725

This fixes #933

title: Fix the incorrect ram map specification for heron-executor
body:
Currently when constructing the ram map for heron-executor in scheduler,
it just considers the component_ram_map config, i.e. ignores the container_ram_requested
config.

This pull request fixs this issue: it constructs the actual ram map from the actual packing plan,
which represents the processed value.

repo.name: incubator-heron

title: Rewrite RoundRobinPacking class to fix bugs
body:
Current RoundRobinPacking can not calculate the ram for each instance correctly,
when the container_ram_request is specified. Also, it lacks necessary unit tests to prove its
correctness.

This pull request rewrites the RoundRobinPacking and adds unit tests to make sure
it behaves as expected.

repo.description: Apache Heron (Incubating) is a realtime, distributed, fault-tolerant stream processing engine from Twitter

title: return str type for __str__ function
body:
#### Problem:

According to [Python 2.7 Documentation: Data Model](https://docs.python.org/2.7/reference/datamodel.html#object.__str__):

> object.**str**(self)
> Called by the str() built-in function and by the print statement to compute the informal string representation of an object. This differs from **repr**() in that it does not have to be a valid Python expression: a more convenient or concise representation may be used instead. **The return value must be a string object**.

However, currently `__str__` of `Graph` class at [heron/ui/src/python/handlers/common/graph](https://github.com/twitter/heron/blob/master/heron/ui/src/python/handlers/common/graph.py#L35) simply prints out the value. According to Python language's behavior, value `None` is returned by default, which is **not** a string object.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3656079/16067030/61a6f548-326d-11e6-8354-89cfba2f80bd.png)
#### Solution:

change to `return str(...)` to return a string object

title: Increase the minimal queue size for Communicator
body:
Currently we use a strategy tuning the soft capacity of Communicator,
which can trigger back-pressure too easily.
In this pull request, we increase the minimal queue size from 0 to 1,
enhancing the concurrent processing between Gateway and Slave thread.

End-to-end tested with LocalScheduler.

title: Remove dependency on log4j-over-slf4j
body:
This fixes #620. Heron does not use log4j api and hence does not need
log4j-over-slf4j. Packing this jar can result in conflicts in cases where
slf4j-log4j binding is present.

title: Fix broken Dockerfile code sample syntax
body: At the moment, the `Dockerfile` syntax highlighting on [this page](http://twitter.github.io/heron/docs/developers/compiling/docker/) is broken because it was generated using an outdated version of [Pygments](http://pygments.org/), which is used by [Hugo](http://gohugo.io/) to generate those snippets. This PR changes the website setup script to include installation of Pygments 2.1.3, which supports the `Dockerfile` syntax.

title: #816 compile heron with bazel 0.2.3
body:
Since Bazel Release 0.1.5 (2016-02-05)  

"Repository rules must use names that are valid workspace names.", see: https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel/issues/874

```
  heron git:(master)  bazel version 
Build label: 0.2.3
Build target: bazel-out/local-fastbuild/bin/src/main/java/com/google/devtools/build/lib/bazel/BazelServer_deploy.jar
Build time: Tue May 17 14:21:13 2016 (1463494873)
Build timestamp: 1463494873
Build timestamp as int: 1463494873
```

title: Fix broken script URL
body:
The URL that is shown to users for more information (http://heronstreaming.io/docs/install.html) does not exist. This PR changes the script template to provide the correct URL (http://heronstreaming.io/docs/getting-started.html) and adds an alias to the Getting Started doc that will redirect users seeing the incorrect URL to the right doc.

The proper re-routing behavior can be seen by going to this link to my personal fork of the website: http://lucperkins.github.io/heron/docs/install.html

title: Add note that Tracker requires ZK paths before starting.
body:
Tracker is a readonly service that does not create ZK nodes if they don't exist, and it might fail with `NoNodeError` if `/topologies` node does not exist under the rootpath. This PR adds this note to the documentation.

Fixes #824.

title: Fix sidebar accordion issue
body:
Previously, the sidebar accordion nav in the docs worked only inconsistently. I believe that I've found a much better solution here that also uses local storage to maintain state across refreshes.

A working example can be found here:

http://lucperkins.github.io/heron/docs/getting-started

title: Fix jQuery URL
body: The current jQuery URL (as set in `website/config.yaml`, under `params:assets:js`) is HTTP when it should be HTTPS, which may cause issues in HTTPS only environments.
